title: Bed Bath & Beyond stock falls after Q2 results; CEO announcement 'soon'
text: Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. fell more than 4% in the extended session Wednesday after the retailer reported an adjusted fiscal second-quarter profit above Wall Street expectations but said same-store sales fell more than expected. Bed Bath & Beyond said it lost $139 million, or $1.12 a share, in the quarter, versus a profit of $49 million, or 36 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter. Adjusted for one-time items, the company reported adjusted net earnings of $42 million, or 34 cents a share, compared with 38 cents a share a year ago. Revenue fell 7% to $2.7 billion. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected an adjusted EPS of 27 cents a share on sales of $2.7 billion. Same-store sales declined about 6.7%, whereas the analysts surveyed by FactSet had expected a decline around 5.4%. In the same statement, Bed Bath & Beyond said it had made "substantial progress" toward hiring a new chief executive, and it expects to make an announcement "soon." The shares ended the regular trading day down 2.9%.
